title: [+] Added MissileContinious (same as MissileStay, but can show it's animation…
message:
[+] Added MissileContinious (same as MissileStay, but can show it's animation several times and damage with Sleep period).
[+] Added NoRandomPlacing flag in CUnitType to prevent random sprite rotation.
[+] Added BoxOffsetX and BoxOffsetY in CunitType to move selection box around unit.
[+] Abilty to set missile's damage and TTL directly in MissileType
[+] Allow CAnimation_SetVar to change non-CVariable variables (currently works for DamageType)
[+] Added ButtonCheckUnitVariable which allow to show button only if some variables pass the condition.
[+] More flexibility to particles.
[+] Added ninth button to PieMenu.
[+] Added ability to set text color in butrton popups.
[+] Allow CAnimation_SpawnMissile to fire missile at some position instead of unit.
[*] Clean up in UnitOnScreen
[*] Units first call their auto-cast spells rather than attacking.
[*] Change new unit message minimap ping color to green.
[*] Some changes in ai threat calculation code.
[*] Units won't "follow" after buildings (this caused them to "stop" and do nothing)
[*] Set GLMaxTextureSize to 256
[-] Removed hardcoded upgrade-to frame
[-] Fix incorrect AiBuildingRules check.
[-] Fix incorrect CUnitType impacts parse
[-] Fixed bug which made AI's summoned units to be in group 0 and thus didn't allowed them o attack enemies properly.
[-] Fixed bug which not allowed player to save his replay at the end of mission.
[-] Fixed a bug which caused AI to send his defence forces only once. 
[-] Removed assert warning in AiReduceMadeInBuilt

title: [+] Added MissileType::PierceOnce flag, which allows missile to pierce and…
message:
[+] Added MissileType::PierceOnce flag, which allows missile to pierce and damage each unit only once.
[*] Better sort for units with equal draw level
[-] Fixed typo in speedup
[-] Fixed compilation foe windows

title: [+] Added new RadialParticle
message:
[+] Added new RadialParticle
[+] Make particles more configurable from Lua
[+] Added 'g' flag for ParseAnimInt to get flag for target unit
[+] Added MissileOffsets array which allows more correct placing for missile's starting point (not from unit's center, but from cannon's hole etc.)
[+] Added CclGetUnitBoolFlag to get unit's bool-flags in Lua
[+] Removed speedup variables (SpeedResourcesHarvest, SpeedResourcesReturn, SpeedBuild, SpeedTrain, SpeedUpgrade, SpeedResearch) into player's code, now speedup could be set individually for each player
[+] Added CUpgradeModifier::ModifyPercent for modifying variables by percent, not by const value.
[+] Added MissileType::Pierce to allow missiles damage everything on their way
[+] Added map preview image generation function for editor (not ready for OpenGL yet)
[+] Added flag for CclCreateMissile to control missile's damage
[*] Missiles now fly into unit's center (according to the comment in code, the old behaviour was to be used for bunkers)
[-] Fixed random number generation code in animations
[-] Fixed "Flushing removed unit" message for boarded units
[-] Fixed unit death into container (happens when unit is temporary)
[-] Fixed land-only restriction for transporters
[-] Fixed "spell-cast" mouse action for non-enemy units (now it's possible to use this action for medics)
[-] Fixed compilation for MSVC9

title: [+] Great improvement of AI:
message:
[+] Great improvement of AI:
- The AI unit will prefer only those targets, which have specified set of flags, use new UnitType field PriorityTarget (same syntax as in CanTargetFlag)
- AI workers prefer to find mines near to depots.
- More effective control to defence forces, the idle units always try to attack back.
- Fixed new goal finding to attacking AI forces.
- Try to prefer buildings as a goal for attacking forces.
- Special threshold counter which didn't allow AI to change target for some time.
- Fixed AiHelpMe for non-building units.
[-] Fixed incorrect CUnit::TTL countdown.

[+] Move CUnitType._Storing to stats, it's possible to use Storing in upgrades.
[*] Don't check the builder in CBuildRestrictionDistance
[*] Don't restore the saved attack order for dead units.
[-] Fixed bug which didn't let the defence force to retaliate.

title: [+]Integer constants in animations could be given as unit's or player's variables.
message:
[+]Integer constants in animations could be given as unit's or player's variables.
	Definition of animation variable: 
	v_<unit_variable.tag>, where unit_variable - any variable(you can also use user defined variables) of the current unit, tag - variable's tag(Value,Max,Increase,Enable,Percent).
Example: v_HitPoints.Value
Percent returns the proportion between Value and Max in range 0..100
	t_<unit_variable.tag> - same as previous, but refers to unit's current goal unit(target in attack animation, mine in resource etc.). If goal doesn't exist, returns 0.
	p_<playernum.property[.argument]> - where playernum - player's number(you can use "this" to refer the unit's player), property - player's property(see the GetPlayerData function for more information), optional <argument> - specifies the property's argument(need for resources and unit-types)
Examples: p_1.TotalUnitLimit p_this.Resources.gold
	r_<value> - returns the random value between 0 and <value>
Though if vaiable couldn't be reconized, game will try to convert it into integer constant(0 will be returned if convertation fails).
[+]New actions in animations:
	(modified) "spawn-missile <missile-type> <startx> <starty> <destx> <desty> <flags>" - spawns <missile-type> relative to the current unit adding <startx> and <starty> to position. <destx> and <desty> specify the missile's destination point. Could be used as more configurable replacement to the standard "attack" action. <flags> used to configure the action, you should specify it separated by points:
		"damage" - missile will generate damage, values are taken from the action unit.
		"totarget" - missile will ignore <destx> and <desty> and will fly to unit's current goal.
		"pixel" - missile will use pixel coordinates instead of tile coordinates, useful for more accurate missile placing.
		"reltarget" - the source of missile will be the unit's current target, so all parameters will be calculated depending of target's parameters, not source's(even the "totarget" will shot the missile back to source unit). Through the damage parameters are always taken from the source unit.
		"ranged" - missile will check the current max and min attack ranges from the unit("reltarget" inverses logic)
	"spawn-unit <unit-type> <offx> <offy> <range> <player>" - spawn <unit-type> relative to the current unit adding <offx> and <offy> to position. <range> specifies the maximum distatnce from the source unit.
		Example: "spawn-unit unit-something 2 1 v_AttackRange.Value this"
	"if-var <lvalue> <rvalue> <condition> <state>" - jump animation frame to label <state>, if <lvalue> is <condition> to <rvalue>
		Possible conditions are:
		1 - greater or equal
		2 - greater
		3 - less or equal
		4 - less
		5 - equal
		6 - not equal
		Example: this code will show different animation frames depending of unit's current health:
		 Still = {"if-var v_HitPoints.Percent 50 3 damaged50",
			"frame 0", "wait 1", "frame 0", "wait 1","goto end",
			"label damaged50",
			"frame 1", "wait 1", "frame 1", "wait 1",
			"label end"}

	"set-var <var> <mod> <value>" - sets the current unit's <var> variable. <mod> specifies, how should be <value> applied to <var>:
		1 - <value> will be added to <var>'s current value.
		2 - <value> will be subtracted from <var>'s current value.
		3 - <var>'s current value will be multiplied to <value>.
		4 - <var>'s current value will be divided to <value>.
		5 - <var>'s current value will be divided to <value> and remainder will be taken as value.
			Warning: if <value> = 0 in 4 and 5, the game will bomb out with a error.
	"set-player-var <player> <var> <value> <mod>[ <argument>]" - sets the <player>'s <var>. The <value> and <mod> are used same as in set-var. Optional <argument> - specifies the <var>'s argument(need for resources and unit-types)
	"die[ <deathtype>]" - causes unit to die. If <deathtype> is set, unit will play his extra death animation depending on <deathtype>, if he has one.
[-]Health states in animations are removed, should use "if-var" animation to do this.

Patch frpm Cybermind

title: New unit-type flag "Wall", which will treat unit as wall.
message:
New unit-type flag "Wall", which will treat unit as wall.
This will use the unit's Direction field to show different wall connections.
The unit should be a building and have NumDirections = 16 and Flip = false.
The wall unit didn't count in GetNumOpponents. When it attacked, AI didn't fight back and no warnings are shown.

NOTE: need to modify triggers, so they won't count the wall units when calculating player's remaining units. Not needed for those games which don't use this feature. 

Wall mapping:
 Frame 0 - wall without connections.
 Frame 1 - wall with north connection.
 Frame 2 - wall with west connection.
 Frame 3 - wall with north and west connections.
 Frame 4 - wall with south connection.
 Frame 5 - wall with south and north connections.
 Frame 6 - wall with south and west connections.
 Frame 7 - wall with south, north and west connections.
 Frame 8 - wall with east connection.
 Frame 9 - wall with east and north connections.
 Frame 10 - wall with east and west connections.
 Frame 11 - wall with east, north and west connections.
 Frame 12 - wall with east and south connections.
 Frame 13 - wall with east, south and north connections.
 Frame 14 - wall with east, south and west connections.
 Frame 15 - wall with all connections.

patch from Cybermind.

title: Don't recognize tilde syntaxes in text input fields
message:
Don't recognize tilde syntaxes in text input fields

If the user types something like "foo~!bar" in a TextField widget,
then display the tilde as is; the "~!" there does not mean that the
next character is a hot key.  The user is not supposed to know about
any such syntax.

Implemented by having a parallel plain-text CFont that Lua code then
assigns to each TextField it creates.  The plain-text CFont shares
textures with the markup CFont, so the memory cost is minimal.

(Originally, I was instead going to implement this by adding a syntax
parameter to gcn::Font::drawString and all related functions.  That
however was the wrong choice because e.g. gcn::ImageFont::drawString
then had to take the parameter but had no idea what to do with it.)

Plain-text fonts can be used in all other widgets too, such as list
boxes or labels.  This commit does not make any such widgets use them
though, and the choice of font does not currently affect how the
engine checks whether the widget has a hot key defined.

title: gcn::DefaultFont::drawString: Correctly increment x
message:
gcn::DefaultFont::drawString: Correctly increment x

This was doing x += getWidth(text) after drawing each glyph,
but getWidth returns the width of the whole string, thus being
wrong if the string contains more than one glyph.
drawGlyph has already been documented as returning the width
of the single glyph, so use that instead.

This fix is not particularly important, because gcn::DefaultFont
is only a fallback for when the correct font has not been set.

title: CSerializeLua::AppendLuaValue: Pass index to lua_toboolean.
message:
CSerializeLua::AppendLuaValue: Pass index to lua_toboolean.

Do not assume the Boolean value is at the top of the Lua stack,
although it currently always is because CSerializeLua::AppendLuaFields
does not support Boolean values as keys in the table.

title: Initialize AiState before StartEditor
message:
Initialize AiState before StartEditor

Fixes https://savannah.nongnu.org/bugs/?34929

Also, add an assertion to make this kind of bug easier to understand.

title: Replaced AiList and _ai_scripts_ with AiTypes
message:
Replaced AiList and _ai_scripts_ with AiTypes

Also replaced RegisterAi and DefineAi with DefineAiType,
which now takes a table rather than a set of parameters.
This table is the object that DefineAiType adds to AiTypes.
The keys of the table are constant strings, not numbers.

The purpose is to make the engine more aware of AI initialization
functions, although this commit doesn't yet get that far.

title: SaveGlobal: Support sparse integer keys
message:
SaveGlobal: Support sparse integer keys

After assignments such as
  test = {};
  test[42] = 61;
  test[69] = 105;
SaveGlobal used to serialize the variable like this:
  test={61
  , 105
  }
Which was wrong because the keys then became 1 and 2,
rather than 42 and 69.  Fix SaveGlobal so that it outputs
numeric keys where necessary.

While at it, make some more changes:
- Wrap the related functions in a new class, CSerializeLua.
- Append the output into an std::vector, instead of duplicating
  strings everywhere.  This makes it easier to ensure that
  no memory will leak.
- In the global environment, forbid keys that begin with a digit.
- In other tables, allow arbitrary strings as keys.
- Forbid tables that have metatables.
- Blacklist _G (previously a separate check) and AllowedUnits
  (previously blocked by the dashes in its key strings).
- Nicely indent the output with tab characters.

title: Don't assume null-terminated PlyName in DebugPrint
message:
Don't assume null-terminated PlyName in DebugPrint

When printing CNetworkHost::PlyName with DebugPrint, use "%.*s" if the
CNetworkHost is part of CInitMessage, so that printing will terminate
at the end of PlyName even if it was not null-terminated in the
network packet.  (This version of Bos Wars always null-terminates
PlyName when sending, but people might run modified versions.)

title: Fix read of past end of LocalPlayerName
message:
Fix read of past end of LocalPlayerName

If LocalPlayerName was shorter than 14 characters, memcpy would
read past the end of the string.  Fix by using strncpy_s instead.

Unlike strncpy, strncpy_s apparently does not fill the end of
the destination array with null characters; but I checked that
Hosts[].PlyName gets zeroed in NetworkInitClientConnect and
message.u.Hosts[].PlyName in NetworkProcessClientRequest.

If LocalPlayerName is too long (which seems difficult to achieve now
that the UI limits its length), truncate it like before.  That seems
more useful than omitting the name entirely.

title: Don't send uninitialized data in ServerParseWaiting
message: Don't send uninitialized data in ServerParseWaiting

title: Limit the length of LocalPlayerName in the UI
message:
Limit the length of LocalPlayerName in the UI

In the network game protocol, the name of each player is at most 15
bytes of text + 1 byte for a terminating null character.  Don't let
the user type any more than that when starting or joining a network
game.

message:

Nothing calls these functions yet.

the action of the key could not be taken.

title: Fix Lua error backtrace in LuaCallback
message:
Fix Lua error backtrace in LuaCallback

Fix two bugs in error handling of LuaCallback::run:

1. It used the Lua function _TRACEBACK, which exists in Lua 5.0 but
   not in Lua 5.1.  In bos/stratagus SVN trunk r8495 on 2007-01-07,
   LuaCall was changed to use debug.trace instead.  Do the same to
   LuaCallback.

2. It passed the wrong Lua stack index to lua_pcall as the error
   handler function.  lua_gettop returns the index of the topmost
   value, not the index that the next pushed value will get.

Also, remove _TRACEBACK from the blacklist now that it is used neither
in Bos Wars nor in any version of Lua supported by Bos Wars.

title: Remove AI class names.
message:
Remove AI class names.

Originally, a map author could define a separate AI script for each
(class, race) combination.  Each of those scripts also required a
unique name.  Because support for races has been removed, AI class
names are no longer useful.

Remove CAiType::Class; use CAiType::Name instead.  Remove the class
parameter of DefineAi; it was called only from RegisterAi, which
passed the same string as name and class.

Remove CAiType::Script and PlayerAi::Script; use CAiType::Name
instead.  Ignore the "script" tag of DefineAiPlayer when loading
a game, and do not generate it when saving.

This commit does not require any changes in individual AI scripts.

title: Merged big stratagus patch from branch lp:~stratagus/stratagus/doom-wars
message:
Merged big stratagus patch from branch lp:~stratagus/stratagus/doom-wars


changelog
[+] added
[*] modified
[-] bugfix or some change/remove

[+] Shield points for units as in Starcraft
It's possible to ignore target's shield points if ShieldPiercing flag set on attacker
[+] New animations which depend on current unit's health(or below)
Usage: animation_currentHP (Example Still_50 = {...})
[+] Death types and damage types
It's possible now to make "burning" weapon and add additional Death states to unit's animation (like unit burns)
Also you can define new death sounds depend on attacker's damage type.
You need to define additional death types through DefineExtraDeathTypes(death_type1,death_type2,...)
[+] MaxHarvesters field in unittype definition which can set how many workers can harvest some resource inside building at same time (like gold)
[+] New "spawn-missile" action type in DefineAnimations.
It can spawn some missile on unit's center (Example "spawn-missile missile-explode")
[+] Custom cursor for buttons 
Use ButtonCursor field in DefineButton
[+] Description for buttons
Use Description field in DefineButton
[+] Custom sound on button click
Use CommentSound field in DefineButton
[+] New variables in CPreference
ShowMessages : used to show game messages
BigScreen : used to hide ingame panels
[+] SaveCargo boolean in unittype: if set, unit unloads his units inside on death 
[+] Revert back SetMouseScrollSpeed
[+] New Color field for CompleteBar in DefinePanelContents
[*] If you set player's resources through SetPlayerData, the game writes information about it into replay log
TO-DO: need to fix cheats.lua in Stratagus games using Players[x].Resources[y] instead of SetPlayerData to prevent replay desync
[*] If need to construct some mine on resource (like oil patch), the game doesn't check surroundings (for AI)
[*] Events now show colour circle on minimap depending on event priority
[*] Increased unit limits
[*] Missile transparency now can vary
[*] The '*' key on additional panel sets game speed to 100
[*] "RegenerationRate" and "Player" variables in Get(Set)UnitVariable
[-] Fixed incorrect building construction (it was impossible to destroy building while it has been constructing)
[-] Fixed compilation in MSVC
[-] There are no magic for new units
[-] Some changes which need only for Doom Wars
[-] Removed game namespace writing in SavePreferences
[-] Fixed a crash if trying to track unit if nothing selected

title: Move common code to new func TriggerMatchUnitType.
message:

This changes the behavior of CclGetNumUnitsAt a little.  It now checks
unit->Constructed even if unittype is a category rather than an
individual type.  This does not affect the bundled maps because the
only use of GetNumUnitsAt is in campaigns/swindler/level01.sms,
which searches for "unit-assault", and assault units do not appear
on the map before they are fully trained.

title: Fixed crash when exiting because Graphics and GraphicHash are freed before CPatchManager
message:
Fixed crash when exiting because Graphics and GraphicHash are freed before CPatchManager

The earlier fix in bos SVN trunk r9918 on 2010-07-02 does not work
reliably with GCC 4.4.5; it seems std::map::~map does not bother
marking the map as empty.  Instead, rely on C++ constructing objects
in the order of definition and destructing them in the opposite order.

In DEBUG builds, also add assertions to catch any attempt to access
Graphics or GraphicsHash before they are constructed or after they are
destructed.

title: Pass std::string from Lua to C++ by value
message:
Pass std::string from Lua to C++ by value

Don't tell tolua++ that some functions take const std::string &
parameters.  Pretend they are plain std::string instead.
This stops tolua++ from generating code to copy the strings
back to Lua after each call.  The const has no effect on that.

The effect is most noticeable in tolua_stratagus_CPatchManager_newPatchType00.

title: Don't implicitly add NULLs to AnimationMap, UnitTypeMap
message:
Don't implicitly add NULLs to AnimationMap, UnitTypeMap

AnimationsByIdent returned AnimationMap[ident]; UnitTypeByIdent
likewise UnitTypeMap[ident].  std::map::operator[] always returns a
reference to a value in the map; if it doesn't find the key in the
map, it adds it there with a default value.  This could cause spurious
NULL values to be added to these maps, for example if buttons were
defined for nonexistent unit types.

title: Unmark unit field flags for pathfinder calls
message:
Unmark unit field flags for pathfinder calls

Without this, 2x2 units such as unit-pathfinder get blocked by
themselves, and AI forces containing only such units never find an
enemy unit to attack.

Fixes part of: http://savannah.nongnu.org/bugs/?30994
 (Make AI work with naval units)

 (Make AI work with naval units)

title: Preserve WEAK_TARGET flag in more places
message:
Preserve WEAK_TARGET flag in more places

This was a bug in engine/action/action_attack.cpp.  The priority/cost
computations did not get called because the attacking unit forgot that
its goal was weak.  One way to trigger the bug was by telling an
assault unit to go attack a place near an enemy camp.  The assault
unit moved part of the way, then noticed an enemy engineer near the
camp, took him as a weak goal, and killed him.  Next, SubAction became
0 again, and the assault unit was about to continue to the ordered
place, but HandleActionAttack noted that SubAction was 0, and called
CheckForTargetInRange, which found the enemy training camp and set
that as another weak goal, setting unit->SubAction |= WEAK_TARGET.
SubAction thus became 2 = WEAK_TARGET, but HandleActionAttack (still
in "case 0:") noticed that the assault unit now had a goal (weak or
not), and because the training camp was close enough, began also
attacking it and set unit->SubAction = ATTACK_TARGET.  And that's
where the WEAK_TARGET flag was lost.  I guess the same could have
happened without the enemy engineer.

Fix by preserving the WEAK_TARGET flag in each place where SubAction
is changed, unless the flag must be clear there (in which case, assert
that), or the whole order is being replaced (from SavedOrder or just
cleared out).

Fixes: http://savannah.nongnu.org/bugs/?30971
 (Units attack buildings too stubbornly)

title: After a unit is fully harvested, look for similar ones
message:
After a unit is fully harvested, look for similar ones

When a worker finishes harvesting and has no other orders, it looks
for another harvestable unit.  Change this so that if the harvested
unit (e.g. a tree or a rock) contained only one type of resource
(energy or magma), then the worker looks only for units that contain
the same type of resource.  This should help the income stay balanced.

Fixes: http://savannah.nongnu.org/bugs/?30856
 (Workers swich to other resourse type after one deposit complete)

title: Base the CanTarget checks on MovementMask
message:
Base the CanTarget checks on MovementMask

The shipyard is a naval unit but also allowed on land.  It is not a
ShoreBuilding because there aren't enough coast tiles in the Gosh
patches.  This combination made it attackable only by units that have
CanTargetSea=true; CanTargetLand had no effect even though the
shipyard typically has 5 or so land tiles under it.

To make the shipyard attackable also by units that have
CanTargetLand=true, change the CanTarget function so that it treats
UnitTypeLand and UnitTypeNaval as equivalent, and instead examines
MovementMask.  With the Bos Wars game data, the shipyard is the only
unit type affected by this change, I think.

title: Show cursor coordinates in status line of map editor
message:
Show cursor coordinates in status line of map editor

Before: "Patch: guerillawarfare.map - (0, 0): land"
After:  "Patch (0, 0): guerillawarfare.map - Field (12, 34): land"

Also, it now shows the coordinates even if there is no patch under the
cursor.

title: Prevent training big ships in shallow shipyards
message:
Prevent training big ships in shallow shipyards

To train a unit, you now need at least one suitable map field under
the trainer unit.  You can thus no longer train big ships in a
shipyard built at a shallow lake.  Previously, big ships built in such
a place came into existence over the nearest deep water, which could
be at the other side of the map.  You can still get that effect if you
have a shipyard at a small but deep pool and build that full of big
ships, but at least it's now no worse than training an islandful of
engineers and having them leak over to the mainland.

title: Allow at most 8 land tiles under the shipyard
message:
Allow at most 8 land tiles under the shipyard

This fixes the shipyard being too large to fit in the strip of water
that an engineer walking along the coast can survey by himself.

We've got a new type of build restriction now.  I hope it will be
useful for other stuff too.

title: Remove GameSound::WorkComplete
message:
Remove GameSound::WorkComplete

The engine played this sound when a worker finished a building from
inside the building.  Support for that was removed in r9678 on
2010-03-14, and the Bos Wars game data did not have any sound file for
that event anyway.

title: Remove CUnitSound::Repair
message:
Remove CUnitSound::Repair

The engine never plays this sound.  Until r7108 on 2005-03-20, it was
used in AnimateActionBuild and DoActionRepairGeneric.  Nowadays, the
animation script names the sound instead, so it need not be defined in
the unit type.

title: Remove CUnitSound::Harvest
message:
Remove CUnitSound::Harvest

The engine never plays this sound.  Until r7108 on 2005-03-20, it was
used in AnimateActionHarvest.  Nowadays, the animation script names
the sound instead, so it need not be defined in the unit type.

title: Remove DefineUnitType RightMouseAction="sail"
message:
Remove DefineUnitType RightMouseAction="sail"

It has been equivalent to "move" since r5329, and no unit types use it.

title: Remove LandUnit, AirUnit, SeaUnit flags from CUnitType
message:
Remove LandUnit, AirUnit, SeaUnit flags from CUnitType

CUnitType had UnitType, which selected between land, air, and sea;
and also separate LandUnit, AirUnit, and SeaUnit flags.  Remove the
separate flags and always check UnitType instead.  This change does
not affect gameplay because:
- The LandUnit and SeaUnit flags were not read at all.
- The AirUnit flag matched UnitType == UnitTypeFly in all unit types.

title: Patch stratagus-r8003-vc90.patch from…
message:
Patch stratagus-r8003-vc90.patch from http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&aid=2895148&group_id=84903&atid=574267

patch to compile and run stratagus using VC2008 - ID: 2895148

Issue 2. unit.h: undefine NOUSER for VC2008
Fixes compiler error under VC2008.
Changes the code to undefine macro NOUSER in unit.h before including windows.h, otherwise clipboard related functions and structures will be undefined. Also removes duplicated and confusing windows.h includes in util.cpp.

Issue 4. unit_draw.cpp: memset caused access violation
Fixes acess violation when loading Wargus scripts at startup with stratagus RELEASE build.
Function DecorationCclRegister() in unit_draw.cpp use memset to re-initialize C++ object, which breaks internal data structures of STL vector. However, this access violation will only occur when compiled with VC2008 RELEASE profile.
Using vector's clear() method to re-initialize DecoSprite, replacing memset,

Issue 5. minimap.cpp: fix minimap
Fixes minimap showing wrong terrain when playing a game in Wargus.
Two different semantic are used inconsistently to calculate minimap index in minimap.cpp, One is mx + my, the onther is mx + my * Map.Info.MapWidth. This inconsistency causes cause minimap to show wrong terrain.
Changes the code in minimap.cpp to use the first semantic consistently.

Issue 7. loadcamp.cpp: Cleaning Order
Fixes access violation on exiting the game or close the game window directly in DEBUG build.  
Because stratagus.exe try to do a clean exit when compiled with DEBUG profile, which frees a bunch of allocated resources in loadcamp.cpp CleanModules(). But the order seems problematic, causing memory access violation when exits.
It seems that CleanUnitTypes() and CleanPlayers() must be called after CleanUnits(), since UnitType and Players structures are used when cleaning units.
    
Issue 8. mainloop.cpp: Parallel drawing     
Fixes keyboard and mouse issue in a Wargus game: user can't issue any command with keyboard or mouse after the game is started.      
Parallel drawing seems not working under Windows. When run stratagus under a dual-core processor, keyboard and mouse click event cannot be received by GameLogicLoop.       
Changes the code in mainloop.cpp to use only 1 cpu under WIN32.

title: Add undo groups to the map editor
message:
Add undo groups to the map editor

In the map editor, if the user first pressed Ctrl+Shift+t to tile the
selected patch type over the whole map but then wanted to undo that,
he had to press Ctrl+z for quite a while: first to remove all the
added patches one by one, and then to restore the original patches one
by one.  Change this so that one Ctrl+z undoes the whole operation,
and one Ctrl+y redoes it.

Likewise, if the user adds a single patch on top of others and thus
causes the editor to remove them, one Ctrl+z will undo the addition
and all the removals.

It seems there aren't any editor commands that affect multiple units.

title: Fix 24bpp RGB patch support in minimap
message:
Fix 24bpp RGB patch support in minimap

In OpenGL mode, the minimap did not draw any patches in 24bpp RGB
format, such as the "gosh" patches before r9913.  This happened
because GetColor set the alpha as zero by default and the pixels then
became wholly transparent.  Fix by making them wholly opaque.

According to feb, 24bpp RGB patches make blitting too slow and should
not be used.  Anyway, they worked without OpenGL and should work with
OpenGL as well.

title: Rename shallow and deep water in saved games
message:

Call deep water "water", like the old MapFieldWaterAllowed used to be,
and shallow water "pond".  This in the hope of improving compatibility
with games saved by earlier versions.

title: Swap the shallow and deep water bits
message:
Swap the shallow and deep water bits

Assign the old MapFieldWaterAllowed bit 0x0040 to MapFieldDeepWater
and the newly allocated bit 0x0008 to MapFieldShallowWater.  This way,
any patch types that have not yet been updated for water depths
will have all of their water deep, thus allowing all types of ships.
This seems especially handy for the add-on maps at the web site.

I updated the patch definitions with this Perl one-liner:

perl -pe 's/0x([[:xdigit:]]{4})/my $f = hex($1); sprintf("0x%04x", ($f & 0xFFB7) | (($f & 0x0040) >> 3) | (($f & 0x0008) << 3))/eg' patch.lua

title: Simplify editing several patch types in a series
message:
Simplify editing several patch types in a series

In the "Select Patch to Edit" menu, replace the drop-down list
with a large list box, so that the user can select a patch type
with the arrow keys without having to drop the list down first,
and the mouse wheel works too.  After the user returns from the
patch editor, keep the menu open and give the focus back to the
list box so that the arrow keys work right away.

There is still space for a preview of the selected patch type
but I'm not implementing that yet.

message:

Also, rename the flags to better match the behaviour:
MapFieldWaterAllowed to MapFieldShallowWater, and
MapFieldDeepSea to MapFieldDeepWater.
Keep calling them "water" and "sea" in save files though.
(I hope we won't ever need to keep track of salinity.)

title: Flag coasts and deep sea in "gosh" patch types
message:
Flag coasts and deep sea in "gosh" patch types

Reserve a bit for deep sea and support it in the engine.
Transporters cannot move there; other ships can.

and optionally display them in the map editor.
Add coast and deep sea flags to the "gosh" patch types.

title: Simplify PatchEditorCallbackMouse
message:
Simplify PatchEditorCallbackMouse

Don't check in PatchEditorCallbackMouse whether the mouse cursor moved
to a different tile.  If it didn't, then the flags are already
correct, and ChangeFlagsAtMouse changes nothing.  So we can just
always call it.  gprof shows 8624 ChangeFlagsAtMouse calls taking a
total of 0.00 seconds.

title: Fix dragging of water flags in patch editor
message:
Fix dragging of water flags in patch editor

If you flag a tile as water in the patch editor, it's supposed to
clear the land flag.  PatchEditorCallbackButtonDown correctly did
this for the tile on which you pressed the mouse button down, but
PatchEditorCallbackMouse failed to do this for the tiles over which
you then dragged.  The bug caused those tiles to be flagged as both
land and water, so that neither land nor water units could enter them.

Fix by moving the flag updates to a new function ChangeFlagsAtMouse
and calling that from both PatchEditorCallbackButtonDown and
PatchEditorCallbackMouse.  This function reads the desired changes
from two bitmask variables that PatchEditorCallbackButtonDown
initializes.  These variables replace the DraggingFlag and
SetFlagWhileDragging flags.

When clearing MapFieldWaterAllowed and setting MapFieldLandAllowed,
also clear MapFieldCoastAllowed and MapFieldNoBuilding.

Fixes: http://savannah.nongnu.org/patch/?7192

title: Set ThisPlayer when entering the EditorEditUnit state
message:
Set ThisPlayer when entering the EditorEditUnit state

If you opened bottleneck.map in the map editor, clicked the
unit-editing button, selected the vault from the list, and tried
to place that over the existing vault, then the editor correctly
refused to put it there but incorrectly showed the region blocked by
the existing vault as green rather than red.  This happened because
ThisPlayer pointed to Players[0], whose type is PlayerNobody in that
map, and UnitCountSeen had therefore not checked whether the vault
was visible to that player.

If you explicitly selected player 4 in the map editor, even though
the editor had already selected it by default, then the editor did
correctly show the blocked region as red.  This happened because
when EditorCallbackButtonDown sets Editor.SelectedPlayer, it sets
ThisPlayer as well.

It seems ThisPlayer should be Players + Editor.SelectedPlayer whenever
Editor.State is EditorEditUnit.  Make it so when entering that state.

title: Clear ShowPatchOutlines when entering map editor
message:
Clear ShowPatchOutlines when entering map editor

The map editor set Editor.State = EditorSelecting in two situations:
when the user started the editor, and when the user clicked the
SelectButton.  The editor also set Editor.ShowPatchOutlines = false
in the latter case but not in the former.  That variable could thus
be left true if the user clicked PatchButton in the editor, exit
to the main menu, and restarted the editor.

title: Fix gcc sign-compare warning caused by r9819
message:
Fix gcc sign-compare warning caused by r9819

Fix this build error when using "scons debug" with GCC 4.4.3:

g++ -o build/debug/editor/editloop.o -c -fsigned-char -g -Wsign-compare -Wall -Werror -DHAVE_STRCASESTR -DHAVE_STRNLEN -DHAVE_X -D_GNU_SOURCE=1 -D_REENTRANT -DDEBUG -I/usr/local/include -I/usr/include/lua5.1 -I/usr/include -I/usr/include/SDL -Iengine/include -Iengine/guichan/include engine/editor/editloop.cpp
cc1plus: warnings being treated as errors
engine/editor/editloop.cpp: In function 'void EditorMainLoop()':
engine/editor/editloop.cpp:2088: error: comparison between signed and unsigned integer expressions

"make.py debug" does not (yet?) add -Wsign-compare, so the warning did
not occur with that.

title: Added a drop down for units in the editor

title: Reduce the effects of terrain speeds 4, 5, 6, and 7
message:
Reduce the effects of terrain speeds 4, 5, 6, and 7

The scale argument given to UnitShowAnimationScaled is already 1 <<
CMapField::Cost.  Don't use it as a shift count again.  Instead use it
just as a multiplier.

Here is how this change affects the treatment of each terrain speed
that patch types define with the MapFieldSpeedMask bits:

* If the speed is 0, i.e. scale is 1, then the previous version
  divided the delay by 128; this version instead divides by 8.
  However, the largest delay used in the current move animations is 2,
  so the divide operation truncates to zero in either case, and the
  actual results do not change.

* If the speed is 1, i.e. scale is 2, then the previous version
  divided the delay by 64; this version instead divides by 4.
  Again, the actual results do not change.

* If the speed is 2 (which the current patch types do not use),
  i.e. scale is 4, then the previous version divided the delay by 16;
  this version instead divides by 2.  Again, the actual results do not
  change.

* If the speed is 3, i.e. scale is 8, then UnitShowAnimationScaled
  uses the unscaled delays defined in the animation, just as before.

* If the speed is 4 (which the current patch types do not use),
  i.e. scale is 16, then the previous version multiplied the delay by
  256; this version instead multiplies by 2.  This difference is the
  primary purpose of the change.

* If the speed is 5, 6, or 7 (of which the current patch types do not
  use any), then the previous version used an out-of-range shift count
  and typically left the delay unchanged.  This version instead
  multiplies it by 4, 8, or 16.

Fixes: http://savannah.nongnu.org/bugs/?29657
 (Movement cost 4 in patch type is far too slow
  because of 1 << (1 << cost)) calculation)

title: Discard NewOrder if it refers to destroyed unit

If a building has a NewOrder whose Goal points to a destroyed unit,
then clear that order when a unit is trained in that building.
Previously, Bos Wars did this only if the unit was able to execute
the order; not if it changed the order to UnitActionMove.

Test case: Tell a training camp to make the trained units harvest a
tree.  Harvest the tree or blow it up.  Wait until the corpse of the
tree disappears.  Train an assault unit in the camp.  Without this
patch, Assert(Refs && !Destroyed) fails in CUnit::RefsIncrease.

Fixes bug #29303 "Assert failed while playing 4on4.map" http://savannah.nongnu.org/bugs/?29303

title: Fix buffer overflow in unit->Data.Move.Path[]
message:
Fix buffer overflow in unit->Data.Move.Path[]

When saving a game, save unit->Data.Move only if the current order
seems to use that.  In particular, don't save it when the action
of the current order is UnitActionDie (which doesn't use any data),
nor when the unit hasn't yet started executing the current order.
This fix is incomplete in that it never saves unit->Data.Move for
UnitActionResource, even though that does use it for some values
of unit->SubAction; but this is not a new bug.

When loading a game, raise an error if the path data is too long to
fit in unit->Data.Move.Path[].  This avoids memory corruption that
could have security implications.  However, if the current action is
UnitActionDie, which wouldn't use unit->Data.Move in any case, then
ignore any path data so that games saved before this patch can still
be loaded.

Patch #7070 "Fix buffer overflow in unit->Data.Move.Path[]" by 
Kalle Olavi Niemitalo.

title: Draw the sole selected unit even if not in viewport
message:
Draw the sole selected unit even if not in viewport

If only one unit is selected, then draw that one even if it is not in
the viewport, as long as the player is entitled to see it.  This is
because the sight, react, and attack circles drawn by DrawInformations
may still reach the viewport.

This gets a bit messy because an enemy unit hidden in the fog of war
must not be drawn even if selected.  Still, all the functions involved
are defined in the same file, so this hack is not too awful.

This fixes bug #27629 "minor UI issue - only units in viewed area get drawn".

Patch by Kalle Olavi Niemitalo.

title: Make GLMaxTextureSize configurable for systems where the value reported
message:
Make GLMaxTextureSize configurable for systems where the value reported 
by OpenGL causes slow displays.

Let the user limit the size of OpenGL textures, in case OpenGL
reports support for larger textures than it can efficiently draw.
This preference does not appear in any menu screen; it can only
be set by editing ~/.boswars/preferences.lua.

This fixes bug #28727 "Too large textures slow down OpenGL".

title: Incompatibilities with Lua 5.0:
message:
Incompatibilities with Lua 5.0:
The luaopen_* functions (to open libraries) cannot be called directly, like a regular C function. They must be called through Lua, like a Lua function. 
Function lua_open was replaced by lua_newstate to allow the user to set a memory-allocation function. You can use luaL_newstate from the standard library to create a state with a standard allocation function (based on realloc).

title: Don't request supply if we're sleeping.  When the script starts it may
message:

request a better unit than the one we pick here.  If we only have enough
resources for one unit we don't want to build the wrong one.

title: Changed CMapField::Visible to short
message:
Changed CMapField::Visible to short
It was easy to exceed the 255 limit by having units with a large sight range. The new limit is 65535 which hopefully will never be reached.
Fixed bug #1390773: Assertion failed at src/map/map_fog.cpp:256

title: Fixed bug #1378708: Assertion failed when saving a game
message:
Fixed bug #1378708: Assertion failed when saving a game

Jarod42 made some weird changes to action_die.c in revision 1.65

I cannot work out what purpose they serve.  I have made alterations to fix the bug, and produce what I think is
expected behaviour.  Also added an assert to ensure it's in Die, there was a debug message there before.  I
think the assert is more helpful.

Save game saves correctly, as does the complete death process.

title: Fixed bug #1378708: Assertion failed when saving a game
message:
Fixed bug #1378708: Assertion failed when saving a game

Jarod42 made some weird changes to action_die.c in revision 1.65

I cannot work out what purpose they serve.  I have made alterations to fix the bug, and produce what I think is
expected behaviour.  Also added an assert to ensure it's in Die, there was a debug message there before.  I
think the assert is more helpful.

Save game saves correctly, as does the complete death process.

title: Try a waiting algorithm to see if it lowers to pathfinder expense of moving groups.
message:
Try a waiting algorithm to see if it lowers to pathfinder expense of moving groups.

If you run into something that is moving, wait a few cycles to see if you can move,
if you wait too long, repath.  Otherwise continue on the path you were on

title: Fix bug where Unit could stay in the cache on it's death.
message:
Fix bug where Unit could stay in the cache on it's death.
If a unit has a death animation, but not a corpse it would get put into the cache
as it has an animation, but never removed, just released in action_die.cpp

We now check for that condition in action_die.cpp.  Comments were added to unit.cpp
to make it clear what the remove/add to cache is about.

This bug could trigger crashes at any point when a missile is fired into an area
where a unit with the animation but no Corpse died.

title: Fix bug where Unit could stay in the cache on it's death.
message:
Fix bug where Unit could stay in the cache on it's death.

as it has an animation, but never removed, just released in action_die.cpp

We now check for that condition in action_die.cpp.  Comments were added to unit.cpp
to make it clear what the remove/add to cache is about.

This bug could trigger crashes at any point when a missile is fired into an area
where a unit with the animation but no Corpse died.

title: Fixed bug #1349606: Segmentation fault in CGraphic::DrawFrameClipX
message:
Fixed bug #1349606: Segmentation fault in CGraphic::DrawFrameClipX

Buildings can only have 1 construction direction.
Their direction cannot and should not be set during Init.
The Construction phase should be for that one direction.
Once the building has finished being build, a direction is assigned if allowed

message:

Must free the Map.Info at the end, even in GameCancel situations.
Otherwise LoadMap will encounter the incorrect filename in Map.Info and use it anyway.

Otherwise LoadMap will encounter the incorrect filename in Map.Info and use it anyway.

title: Fixed bug #1348218: BOS and Stratagus - APCs don't work.
message:

Teamed Players are Player[a].Team == Player[b].Team NOT SharedVision

Fixed bug #1348218: BOS and Stratagus - APCs don't work.

title: Fixed bug where replay would out of sync on first command on linux
message:
Fixed bug where replay would out of sync on first command on linux

Linux C++ appears to be truncating overflows in a strange way.
LuatoNumber is signed, but SyncSeed is unsigned, so when you import the number
it comes in incorrectly.  It's strictly typed 1 way an then the other to ensure
there are no problems.

I believe GameCycle also has the problem, but we don't usually have games
long than 2 billion cycles.

title: If we are on Version 2.2, then the patch level is zero.

If we are on Version 2.2, then the patch level is zero.
This could be considered dangerous, as CVS will run against the first release
of 2.2.  But in the past, very few people have tried that.

title: Fix crash when starting multiplayer games.
message:
Fix crash when starting multiplayer games.

Reverted hack for DefineMapSetup.
Added default map setup path. The default filename for the map setup file (.sms) is the map presentation (.smp) filename with the extension replaced by '.sms'. The default filename applies when a map presentation doesn't call DefineMapSetup.

title: Fixed allocation size of a buffer which was the target of a sprintf(..,"%p",..).…

A better solution might be better.

title: It is conceivable that a missle may target a unit that is Destroyed.
message:
It is conceivable that a missle may target a unit that is Destroyed.
In such a case, you cannot check Actions as they have been freed.
It is also true that the Action may not be ActionDie if it is destroyed.
As missile can target destroyed items, the check must hold

title: Fixed bug #1182181: Ability to control enemy units.
message:
Fixed bug #1182181: Ability to control enemy units.
Incorporates change to groups.  You can now only add units to groups that
are on your Team.  So you can't group enemy or neutral units. You also cannot
add buildings to a group unless the building is the only thing in the group.
Same goes for trying to add units to a group with a building in it.

title: Fixed bug #1182181: Ability to control enemy units.
message:
Fixed bug #1182181: Ability to control enemy units.
Incorporates change to groups.  You can now only add units to groups that
are on your Team.  So you can't group enemy or neutral units. You also cannot
add buildings to a group unless the building is the only thing in the group.
Same goes for trying to add units to a group with a building in it.

title: Revert Unit::Wait removal.
message:
Revert Unit::Wait removal.
Commands are not currently checked to see if the Data union will stay in
the same state for the entire of the command.  Eg Building a building will
use the movement Data union, and then the built section to produce a building.

If wait is to be placed in this area, it needs to be done very carefully as to
not stand on any toes.  Which it is now doing.  It is debatable that is a good
idea to put it here given the potential for it to cause the problems it is now.
I may just need clear warnings

title: Revert Unit::Wait removal.
message:
Revert Unit::Wait removal.
Commands are not currently checked to see if the Data union will stay in
the same state for the entire of the command.  Eg Building a building will
use the movement Data union, and then the built section to produce a building.

If wait is to be placed in this area, it needs to be done very carefully as to
not stand on any toes.  Which it is now doing.  It is debatable that is a good
idea to put it here given the potential for it to cause the problems it is now.
I may just need clear warnings

title: Removed MAX_ORDERS, units can have as many orders as they require.
message:
Removed MAX_ORDERS, units can have as many orders as they require.
Added Memory management for Orders, so they are reused, less mallocs.

Remove MustRedraw and EnableRedraw, they are not used, everything is redrawn each frame.

Remove TrainingQueue LIMIT, you can train as many units as you like if the training queue is enable.
This needs further configuration work.  But operates correctly.

this.

Changed removed units handling (for buildings/trasporters).
Compacted Rescued and RescuedFrom members of the Unit struct.

title: - added detection of unreachable goals (and finding a substitute goal if none
message:
- added detection of unreachable goals (and finding a substitute goal if none
  of the fields of the original goal is reachable).
- made debugging display configurable using CCL.
- added caching of highlevel paths
- added code that updates the pathfinder's internal description of the map
  when the map changes (there are still bugs that I don't yet understand,
  though).
- modified the lowlevel pathfinder so that its heuristic function takes into
  account information contained in the highlevel path
- modified the lowlevel pathfinder so that it breaks after expanding a certain
  number of nodes (it just needs to find next 2 * MAX_PATH_LENGTH steps and
  with the new heuristic there's no need to compute the whole path over and
  over again).
- added global list of all Regions (speed optimization).
- fixed some old bugs.
- introduced a lot of new ones.

- modified the lowlevel pathfinder so that it breaks after expanding a certain

- added global list of all Regions (speed optimization).

- introduced a lot of new ones.

message:
- added detection of unreachable goals (and finding a substitute goal if none
  of the fields of the original goal is reachable).
- made debugging display configurable using CCL.
- added caching of highlevel paths
- added code that updates the pathfinder's internal description of the map
  when the map changes (there are still bugs that I don't yet understand,
  though).
- modified the lowlevel pathfinder so that its heuristic function takes into
  account information contained in the highlevel path
- modified the lowlevel pathfinder so that it breaks after expanding a certain
  number of nodes (it just needs to find next 2 * MAX_PATH_LENGTH steps and
  with the new heuristic there's no need to compute the whole path over and
  over again).
- added global list of all Regions (speed optimization).
- fixed some old bugs.
- introduced a lot of new ones.

message:

RegGroupId's configurable using CCL.

message:
Added support for hierarchical pathfinder (it can now append its private
data to a unit).

message:
Added support for hierarchical pathfinder.
Added coordinate bound checking to fix SEGV that occured when demolishing
near borders of the map.

title: Added basic support for grouping of regions to RegGroups. This will enable the
message:
Added basic support for grouping of regions to RegGroups. This will enable the
highlevel pathfinder to check very quickly whether the goal is reachable at
all and what to do if it isn't (the pathfinder itself doesn't use GroupId's
yet, however - this is coming soon).

yet, however - this is coming soon).

title: Reworked the make system to support multiple object files for different
message:
Reworked the make system to support multiple object files for different
architectures (cross-compiled..) to reside in different subdirectories.
This allows arch-dependant build without having to do a full recycle
each time.

title: Fixed some over-optimistic optimizations stephan has made.
message:
Fixed some over-optimistic optimizations stephan has made.
whenever a menu background changes (or menu switches) the saved cursor
background has to be destroyed.
Als cursor needs to be hidden before in-game menu is processed,
at least when activated by mouse-click.
